fact_check_explanation_title: Not all people with hearing loss are unable to access extra cancer care help
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet from Macmillan Cancer Support appears to suggest that 11 million people with hearing loss in the UK can’t access extra help following a cancer diagnosis. This is unlikely …

fact_check_explanation_title: Do a disproportionate number of women end up in prison for failing to pay TV licences?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conservative leadership candidate Liz Truss has raised concerns over the number imprisoned, but since 1995 twice as many men have been jailed.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence for a rise in sudden deaths or that Covid-19 vaccines are the cause
fact_check_explanation_summary: SADS or Sudden Adult Death Syndrome does not appear to have increased in the UK in 2021.

fact_check_explanation_title: Would Liz Truss’s plans for regional pay boards have saved £8.8 billion?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We look at the detail of the Conservative leadership candidate’s proposals for public sector pay, which she has now dropped after criticism.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tweet from Liz Truss’s father calling her ‘poo-poo bear’ is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Her father did not tweet saying she couldn’t tie her shoelaces until she was 12.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post’s claim about a newborn baby being found by police in Essex is false
fact_check_explanation_summary: It uses an image of a baby recently found in Arizona.

fact_check_explanation_title: Picture does not show ‘unnatural’ cloud formations
fact_check_explanation_summary: A picture of the sky does not show “unnatural” cloud formations but rather a long-standing natural phenomenon known as “mackerel sky”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral hot dog clip was a ‘deliberate fake’ by creator
fact_check_explanation_summary: An edited version of the TikTok clip, which supposedly shows a hot dog contaminated by dirt and parasites, has been shared without proper context on Facebook.

fact_check_explanation_title: Article about monkeypox living on door handles for 120 years is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: The altered screenshot also claims the virus “can infect anyone from 5 miles away”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Monkeypox is not a cover-up for the effects of the Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence of any link between the recent monkeypox virus outbreak and the Covid-19 vaccines, which do not damage immune systems, as a video claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: No proof ‘cancer cure’ in viral TikTok actually cured cancer
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence that products made by an Amish man who was jailed for breaking FDA laws actually cured disease.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vigorous coughing will not save you during a heart attack
fact_check_explanation_summary: Advice that coughing vigorously could save you in the event of a heart attack is incorrect and could make things worse.
